rationale: The agent's implementation has several critical issues: (1) It modifies an unrelated file (ShardsAllocators.java) which is not part of the ground truth and introduces unnecessary code duplication. (2) It's missing the key constants EVEN_SHARD_COUNT_ALLOCATOR_KEY and BALANCED_ALLOCATOR_KEY that the ground truth defines. (3) The agent uses a different constant name (SHARDS_ALLOCATOR_TYPE_KEY vs TYPE_KEY). (4) Most critically, it's missing the entire test file (ShardsAllocatorModuleTests.java) which represents a significant portion of the ground truth changes. (5) The implementation in ShardsAllocatorModule differs structurally - the ground truth extracts loadShardsAllocator() as a reusable method called in the constructor and configure(), while the agent only calls resolveShardsAllocator() in configure(). (6) The suffix parameter in getAsClass differs ('ShardsAllocator' vs 'Allocator' in ground truth). (7) The agent duplicates the allocator resolution logic in two places (ShardsAllocatorModule and ShardsAllocators), violating DRY principles. While the core functionality might work, the implementation misses key structural elements and test coverage, and introduces unnecessary changes to unrelated files.
